content: black 5 pink 1 black 5 pink 1 black 5 pink 1 black 5 pink 1 black 5 pink 1 black 3 pink change to white yarn 7 chain 1 *5 single_crochet increase* repeat to last st slip_stitch in first st 42 change to green yarn 8 chain 1 single_crochet in each st slip_stitch to first st 42 bind off and sew in all of the ends kiwi with white yarn 1 create a magic_ring chain 1 6 single_crochet in ring slip_stitch to first st 6 change to green yarn 2 chain 1 2 single_crochet in each st around slip_stitch to first st 12 3 chain 1 *single_crochet increase* repeat to last st slip_stitch in first st 18 4 chain 1 *2 single_crochet increase* repeat to last st slip_stitch in first st 24 5 chain 1 *3 single_crochet increase* repeat to last st slip_stitch in first st 30 6 chain 1 *4 single_crochet increase* repeat to last st slip_stitch in first st 36 7 chain 1 *5 single_crochet increase* repeat to last st slip_stitch in first st 42 change to brown yarn 8 chain 1 single_crochet in each st slip_stitch to first st 42 bind off and sew in all of the ends using the black yarn sew on seeds i sewed on 6 seeds in the second round bind off and sew in ends felt backing you can leave the coasters as they are but i didn t like seeing the ends i sewed in so decided to put a felt backing this step will also help to flatten out the coasters take one of the coasters and trace the shape on a piece of felt make sure not to trace too close to the coaster because you don t want to get any ink on the yarn cut the felt hold it up to the coaster and trim any pieces that are sticking out using fabric glue glue the felt onto the back of the coaster put something heavy like a book of two on top on the coasters while the glue dries to help flatten the coaster and help the adhesive let the glue dry for a couple hours then you have yourself some cute summery coasters another alternative to would be to sew the felt backs on it s really up to you
